page.title: 02Goudhurst Village Festival 1
page.content: The Festival held annually in July has a two-fold purpose. 1, to bring friends and families together in a variety of events held in and around the village. 2, to raise funds for St.Mary's church. In l985 the aim was to raise as much as possible towards the thirty thousand pounds required to repair the church roof. The Vicar was the central figure of Festival week. He sought to bring St. Mary's close not only to his parishioners but to everyone living in, or visiting Goudhurst. Hence breakfast in the church followed by a family service, and later a family communion. The church tower was open all week and the exhibition "The way of a Christian" inside the church was received the admiration it deserved.
